title: [16] Project X Research Excerpt #3
contents: [Excerpts from notes written by NARS researchers]
Commonly referred to as "Vile Stingers", these creatures bear a very similar appearance and behavior to the common Stinger creatures.
However, Vile Stingers can be distinguished by their bright red markings.
We now believe that the Projext X pathogen is primarily airborne.
The capsules produced in the main laboratory (and recently, deployed at the order of our Supreme General), contain a dense personalized version of the pathogen.
When the capsule (which is slightly larger than a civilian refrigerator) is deployed, it contaminates a large area with the pathogen.
Like all of the other unique organisms produced by the Project X program, Vile Stingers are designed to serve a specific battlefield role.
Vile Stingers seem to be designed to contaminate targets that would otherwise be protected by armored vehicles or structures.
The flechettes launched by Vile Stingers are hollowed out; their insides are filled with a mucus-like material that contains the pathogen in high concentrations.
On impact, these projectiles burst, spreading the contaminated mucus onto (and potentially into) the target.
Due to these capabilities, Vile Stingers should always be priority targets for our forces, should they be forced to engage with the Infested.
Cognitively, Vile Stingers appear to the most capable among any of the Project X related organisms.
Most strikingly, Vile Stingers have a rare talent; a basic sense of self-preservation.
As reported by multiple of our flamer squads, they have a tendency to flee or create distance between themselves and their attackers.
